results.title: Outward bound
results.brief_description: Describes courses at the two “Outward Bound” schools where boys from all walks of life are provided with character training. At Aberdovey on the coast of Wales, four weeks training is given to young boys bound for the Merchant Navy. At the school in Eskdale, Cumberland, special attention is given to the skills necessary in mountain climbing and life-saving.

results.title: Outward bound
results.brief_description: This film follows a group of six young men on the 99th Outward Bound Course. The dialogue conveys their thoughts and feelings as they take part in rock-climbing, canoeing, caving, cross-country running, and camping. Shows the different reactions of the group to the challenge of survival in these conditions. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Outward bound
results.creator_credit: Summit Films, Crystal Productions, Barry Corbet, Roger C. Brown, Robert Fulton and Joern Gerdts
results.brief_description: The benefits of the outward bound course, including increased autonomy and knowledge of people, and the psychological kick to be had from danger. Good photography and much use of music. This is not an instructional film.

results.title: Outside the golden ring
results.creator_credit: National Broadcasting Company and George Lindsey
results.brief_description: Studies the non-traditional marriages of today - homosexual, older-younger, black-white and the unmarrieds. It opens with a sequence inside a gay bar in Washington, D.C. as two homosexuals tell about their marriage. Other participants in the non-traditional marriages are also interviewed. The film examines the life styles and frustration’s of these marriages and includes analysis and comments by two psychologists and a marriage counsellor.

results.title: Outside in
results.brief_description:
Beautiful 3-d computer animated tale of fantasy and magic when three individual lives are entwined through a twist of fate allowing their true nature to surface in a most unexpected way. No spoken word.
Created as part of Master of Fine Arts Degree in Image Arts/Computer Animation, School of Film and Animation, Rochester Institute of Technology, New York.

results.title: Outrageous fortune
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Interscope communications, Ted Field, Robert W. Cort and Arthur Hiller
results.brief_description: A madcap comedy involving a menage a trois and espionage. Two actresses who don’t get along with each other, Sandy (Bette Midler) and Lauren (Shelley Long) find out they are both dating the same man, Michael (Peter Coyote). All hell breaks loose when they discover that Michael is a spy working for a foreign government and that he has implicated them both in his schemes. Cast includes Robert Prosky, John Schuck, George Carlin.

results.title: Outlook: the line
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Gil Brealey and Christopher McGill
results.brief_description: This film was made to commemorate the first crossing of Australia by the standard gauge railway line between Sydney and Perth. It does not attempt to trace this trip, rather, it attempts to capture the spirit of the crossing, the flashes of raw colour as the bleak but beautiful Australian landscape rips past crossing the endless unbroken space of nowhere.

results.title: Outline of activity sampling
results.brief_description: Uses a petrol station to show, stage by stage, how the technique of activity sampling can be employed to give a reliable picture of what is happening; a picture that can then be used as the basis for improved methods of work.

results.title: Outland
results.creator_credit: The Ladd Company, Richard Roth and Peter Hyams
results.brief_description: On Io, the innermost moon of Jupiter, the volcanic landscape is desolate. For the Con-Am 27 mining colony, populated by misfits and losers, it is home. Violence bubbles benath the surface, ready to explode. Federal District Marshall, William T. O’Niel, (Sean Connery), is sent to investigate the grisly, frenzied deaths amongst the miners, and must struggle alone in the pursuit of truth. This is a grim view of the future, where productivity takes precendence over humanity.
